<A NAME="eolPage52"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	1.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Description of the business
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	FirstService Corporation (the &#8220;Company&#8221;) is a provider of real estate-related services to commercial, institutional and residential customers in North America and various countries around the world.&#160;&#160;The Company&#8217;s operations are conducted in three segments: Commercial Real Estate Services, Residential Property
	Management and Property Services.&#160;&#160;The Company reported two former segments in discontinued operations: (i) Integrated Security Services segment, which was sold in July 2008 and (ii) Business Services segment, which was disposed of in March 2006.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In May 2008, the Company&#8217;s Board of Directors approved a change in the Company&#8217;s fiscal year-end from March 31 to December&#160;31.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, comparative prior period results include the financial statements for the nine-month period ended December 31, 2008.&#160;&#160;See note 23 for unaudited transition period
	comparative results for the twelve month period ended December 31, 2008 and the nine-month period ended December 31, 2007.
</FONT>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	2.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Summary of significant accounting policies
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	These consolidated financial statements have been restated to reflect the retrospective adoption of new accounting standards for non-controlling interests (see below).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The preparation of consolidated financial statements in accordance with accounting principles generally accepted in the United States of America (&#8220;GAAP&#8221;) requires management to make estimates and assumptions that affect the reported amounts of assets and liabilities and disclosures of contingent assets and liabilities at the
	date of the financial statements, and the reported amounts of revenues and expenses during the reporting period.&#160;&#160;The most significant estimates are related to the fair value determination of assets acquired and liabilities assumed in business combinations, impairment testing of fair values of goodwill and intangible assets, the collectability of accounts receivable and recoverability of deferred income taxes assets.&#160;&#160;Actual results could be materially different from these estimates.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of July 1, 2009, the Financial Accounting Standards Board (&#8220;FASB&#8221;) Accounting Standards Codification (&#8220;ASC&#8221;) became the single source for authoritative non-governmental GAAP in the United States of America and superseded all existing non-SEC accounting and reporting standards.&#160;&#160;All other non-grandfathered
	non-SEC accounting literature not included in the ASC became non-authoritative.&#160;&#160;The Company adopted the ASC and all references to US GAAP are to the ASC topic number, rather than to the previous FASB Statement of Accounting Standards numbers and titles, unless a specific standard has not been included in the ASC.&#160;&#160;The adoption of the ASC did not have a material effect on the Company&#8217;s results of operations or financial position.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Significant accounting policies are summarized as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Basis of consolidation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The consolidated financial statements include the accounts of the Company, its majority-owned subsidiaries and those variable interest entities where the Company is the primary beneficiary.&#160;&#160;Where the Company does not have a controlling interest but has the intent and ability to exert significant influence, the equity method
	is used.&#160;&#160;Inter-company transactions and accounts are eliminated on consolidation.
</FONT>
<BR>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	10
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="4">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage53"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Cash and cash equivalents
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Cash equivalents consist of short-term interest-bearing securities, which are readily convertible into cash and have original maturities at the date of purchase of three months or less.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Restricted cash
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Restricted cash consists of cash and cash equivalents over which the Company has legal ownership but is restricted as to its availability or intended use, including funds held on behalf of clients and franchisees.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<BR>
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_19"></A>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Inventories
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Inventories are carried at the lower of cost and market.&#160;&#160;Cost is determined by the weighted average or first in, first out methods.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Fixed assets
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Fixed assets are carried at cost less accumulated depreciation.&#160;&#160;The costs of additions and improvements are capitalized, while maintenance and repairs are expensed as incurred.&#160;&#160;Fixed assets are depreciated over their estimated useful lives as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Buildings&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
	20 to 40 years straight-line
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Vehicles&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;
	3 to 5 years straight-line
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Furniture and equipment&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; 3 to 10 years straight-line
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Computer equipment and software&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;3 to 5 years straight-line
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Leasehold improvements&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;term of the lease to a maximum of 10 years
</FONT>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT ID="TAB1" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT">
</FONT>
	Investments in securities
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT; TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company classifies investments in securities as a component of other assets.&#160;&#160;Investments in available-for-sale marketable equity securities are carried at fair value with unrealized gains and losses included in other comprehensive earnings on an after-tax basis.&#160;&#160;Investments in other equity securities are
	accounted for using the equity method or cost method, as applicable.&#160;&#160;Realized gains or losses and equity earnings or losses are recorded in other income.&#160;&#160;Equity securities, including marketable equity securities as well as those accounted for under the equity method and cost method, are regularly reviewed for impairment based on both quantitative and qualitative criteria that include the extent to which cost exceeds market value, the duration of the market decline, the Company&#8217;s intent
	and ability to hold until forecasted recovery, and the financial health and prospects for the issuer.&#160;&#160;Other-than-temporary impairment losses on equity securities are recorded in current period earnings.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Financial instruments and derivatives
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Derivative financial instruments are recorded on the consolidated balance sheets as assets or liabilities and carried at fair value.&#160;&#160;The Company uses interest rate swaps to hedge a portion of its interest rate exposure on long term debt.&#160;&#160;Hedge accounting has been applied and the swaps are carried at fair value on
	the consolidated balance sheets, with gains or losses recognized in earnings.&#160;&#160;The carrying value of the hedged item is adjusted for changes in fair value attributable to the hedged interest rate risk; the associated gain or loss is recognized currently in earnings.&#160;&#160;If swaps are terminated, the resulting gain or loss is deferred and recognized over the remaining life of the underlying item.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company adopted a new accounting standard requiring additional disclosure for derivatives and hedging activities on January 1, 2009.&#160;&#160;The new standard includes enhanced disclosures about the Company&#8217;s derivative and hedging activities such as the objective for using derivative instruments, the method of accounting for
	derivative instruments and related hedged items, and the effect of derivative instruments and related hedged items on the Company&#8217;s financial position, financial performance, and cash flows.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	11
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="4">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage54"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Fair value
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As of January 1, 2009, the Company began to apply a new accounting standard on fair value measurements to all non-financial assets and liabilities that are recognized or disclosed at fair value on a non-recurring basis which is consistent with the fair value requirements for financial assets and liabilities.&#160;&#160;The adoption of
	this standard did not have a material effect on the Company&#8217;s results of operations or financial position.&#160;&#160;Where required, assets and liabilities are measured using inputs from the three levels of the fair value hierarchy.&#160;&#160;An asset or liability&#8217;s classification within the hierarchy is determined based on the lowest level input that is significant to the fair value measurement.&#160;&#160;The three levels are as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Level 1 &#8211; Quoted prices (unadjusted) in active markets for identical assets or liabilities
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Level 2 &#8211; Observable market-based inputs other than quoted prices in active markets for identical assets or liabilities
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Level 3 &#8211; Unobservable inputs
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Financing fees
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Financing fees related to the revolving credit facility, Senior Notes and Convertible Debentures are deferred and amortized to interest expense using the effective interest method.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Goodwill and intangible assets
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Goodwill represents the excess of purchase price over the fair value of assets acquired and liabilities assumed in a business combination and is not subject to amortization.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Intangible assets are recorded at cost and, where lives are finite, are amortized over their estimated useful lives as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_20"></A>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Customer lists and relationships&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;straight-line over 4 to 20 years
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Franchise rights&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;by pattern of use, currently
	estimated at 2.5% to 15% per year
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Trademarks and trade names:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Indefinite life&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;not amortized
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
<FONT ID="TAB1" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT">
</FONT>
	Finite life&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160; straight-line
	over 15 to 35 years
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Management contracts and other&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;straight-line over life of contract ranging from 2 to 15 years
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Brokerage backlog&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;as underlying brokerage transactions are completed
</FONT>
</DIV>
</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company adopted additional guidance issued to assist in the determination of the useful life of intangible assets on January 1, 2009.&#160;&#160;The new guidance amends the factors used when considering the useful life of recognized intangible assets.&#160;&#160;The adoption did not have a material effect on the Company&#8217;s results
	of operations or financial position.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company reviews the carrying value of finite life intangible assets for impairment whenever events or changes in circumstances indicate that the carrying amount of an asset group may not be recoverable from the estimated future cash flows expected to result from their use and eventual disposition.&#160;&#160;If the sum of the undiscounted
	expected future cash flows is less than the carrying amount of the asset group, an impairment loss is recognized.&#160;&#160;Measurement of the impairment loss is based on the excess of the carrying amount of the asset group over the fair value calculated using discounted expected future cash flows.
</FONT>
<BR>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	12
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="4">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage55"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Goodwill and indefinite life intangible assets are tested for impairment annually or more frequently if events or changes in circumstances indicate the asset might be impaired, in which case the carrying amount of the asset is written down to fair value.&#160;&#160;Impairment of goodwill is tested at the reporting unit level by comparing
	the reporting unit&#8217;s carrying amount, including goodwill, to the fair value of the reporting unit.&#160;&#160;The Company has eight reporting units determined with reference to business segment, customer type, service delivery model and geography.&#160;&#160;The fair values of the reporting units are estimated using a discounted cash flow approach. The fair value measurement is classified in Level 3 of the fair value hierarchy. If the carrying amount of the reporting unit exceeds its fair value, then a
	second step is performed to measure the amount of impairment loss, if any.&#160;&#160;Certain assumptions are used to determine the fair value of the reporting units, the most sensitive of which are estimated future cash flows and the discount rate applied to future cash flows. Changes in these assumptions could result in a materially different fair value. Impairment of indefinite life intangible assets is tested by comparing the carrying amount to fair value on an individual intangible asset basis.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Convertible debentures
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company issued Convertible Debentures in November 2009 (see note 11).&#160;&#160;The Convertible Debentures are accounted for entirely as debt as no portion of the proceeds is required to be accounted for as attributable to the conversion feature.&#160;&#160;Interest on the Convertible Debentures is recorded as interest expense.&#160;&#160;The
	earnings per share impact of the Convertible Debentures is calculated using the &#8220;if-converted&#8221; method, if dilutive, where coupon interest expense, net of tax, is added to the numerator and the number of potentially issuable common shares is added to the denominator.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Non-controlling interests
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On January 1, 2009, the Company adopted new accounting standards for non-controlling interests (&#8220;NCI&#8221;). Except for earnings per share calculations, all presentation and disclosure requirements of were adopted retrospectively, and as a result the Company recorded an increase to NCI of $105,694 (see note 12) and a corresponding
	decrease to shareholders&#8217; equity as of April 1, 2007.&#160;&#160;As a result of retrospective adoption, all periods presented have been restated for the effect of the adoption of this standard, however consistent with the transition provisions the Company presented the effect of the adoption of these standards on earnings per share prospectively, effective January 1, 2009.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The NCI are considered to be redeemable securities and accordingly, the NCI is recorded at the greater of (i) the redemption amount or (ii) the amount initially recorded as NCI at the date of inception of the minority equity position.&#160;&#160;&#160;This amount is recorded in the &#8220;mezzanine&#8221; section of the balance sheet,
	outside of shareholders&#8217; equity.&#160;&#160;Changes in the NCI amount are recognized immediately as they occur.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Revenue recognition and unearned revenues
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(a)&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Real estate brokerage operations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Commission revenues from sales brokerage transactions are recognized at the time the service has been provided and the commission becomes legally due, except when future contingencies exist.&#160;&#160;In most cases, close of escrow or transfer of title is a future contingency, and accordingly revenue recognition is deferred until this
	contingency is satisfied.
</FONT>
<BR>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	13
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="4">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage56"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Commission revenues from real estate leasing are recognized once obligations under the commission arrangement are satisfied.&#160;&#160;Terms and conditions of a commission arrangement generally include execution of the lease agreement and satisfaction of future contingencies such as tenant occupancy.&#160;&#160;In most cases, a portion
	of the commission is earned upon execution of the lease agreement, with the remaining portion contingent on a future event, typically tenant occupancy; revenue recognition for the remaining portion is deferred until all contingencies are satisfied.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(b)&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Franchisor operations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company operates several franchise systems within its Property Services segment.&#160;&#160;Initial franchise fees are recognized when all material services or conditions related to the sale of the franchise have been performed or satisfied.&#160;&#160;Royalty revenues are recognized based on a contracted percentage of franchisee revenues,
	as reported by the franchisees.&#160;&#160;Revenues from administrative and other support services, as applicable, are recognized as the services are provided.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	(c)&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Service operations other than real estate brokerage and franchisor operations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Revenues are recognized at the time the service is rendered.&#160;&#160;Certain services including but not limited to real estate project management and appraisal projects in process, are recognized on the percentage of completion method, generally in the ratio of actual costs to total estimated contract costs.&#160;&#160;In cases where
	anticipated costs to complete a project exceed the revenue to be recognized, a provision for the additional estimated losses is recorded in the period when the loss becomes apparent.
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 12PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	Amounts received from customers in advance of services being provided are recorded as unearned revenues when received.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Stock-based compensation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	For equity classified awards, compensation cost is measured at the grant date based on the estimated fair value of the award.&#160;&#160;The related stock option compensation expense is allocated using the graded attribution method.&#160;&#160;For liability classified awards, the fair value of the award is measured each period it is outstanding
	and changes in fair value are recorded as compensation expense.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Notional value appreciation plans
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Under these plans, subsidiary employees are compensated if the notional value of the subsidiary increases.&#160;&#160;Awards under these plans generally have a ten year term and vest after five years.&#160;&#160;The increase in notional value is calculated with reference to growth in earnings relative to a fixed threshold amount plus or
	minus changes in indebtedness relative to a fixed opening amount.&#160;&#160;The calculation is designed to motivate and reward employees to grow earnings and repay indebtedness and is not measured by or linked to the growth in value of the subsidiary&#8217;s stock.&#160;&#160;If an award is subject to a vesting condition, then graded attribution is applied to the intrinsic value.&#160;&#160;The related compensation expense is recorded in selling, general and administrative expenses and the liability is recorded
	in accrued liabilities.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Foreign currency translation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Assets, liabilities and operations of foreign subsidiaries are recorded based on the functional currency of each entity.&#160;&#160;For certain foreign operations, the functional currency is the local currency, in which case the assets, liabilities and operations are translated at current exchange rates from the local currency to the reporting
	currency, the US dollar.&#160;&#160;The resulting unrealized gains or losses are reported as a component of cumulative other comprehensive earnings.&#160;&#160;Realized and unrealized foreign currency gains or losses related to any foreign dollar denominated monetary assets and liabilities are included in net earnings.
</FONT>
<BR>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	14
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="4">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage57"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Income tax
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Income tax has been provided using the liability method whereby deferred income tax assets and liabilities are recognized for the expected future income tax consequences of events that have been recognized in the consolidated financial statements or income tax returns.&#160;&#160;Deferred income tax assets and liabilities are measured
	using enacted income tax rates expected to apply to taxable income in the years in which temporary differences are expected to be recovered or settled.&#160;&#160;The effect on deferred income tax assets and liabilities of a change in income tax rates is recognized in earnings in the period in which the change occurs.&#160;&#160;A valuation allowance is recorded unless it is more likely than not that realization of a deferred income tax asset will occur.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On January 1, 2007, the Company adopted new accounting standards for accounting for uncertainty in income tax. This standard prescribes a recognition threshold and measurement attribute for the financial statement recognition and measurement of a tax position taken or expected to be taken in a tax return.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Income tax is not provided on the unremitted earnings of US and foreign subsidiaries because it has been the practice and is the intention of the Company to reinvest these earnings indefinitely in these subsidiaries.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company classifies interest and penalties associated with income tax positions in income tax expense.
</FONT>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	3.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Acquisitions
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company adopted a new accounting standard for business combinations on January 1, 2009.&#160;&#160;The new standard prospectively changes the manner in which business acquisitions are accounted for.&#160;&#160;The following are key requirements for acquisitions completed under the standard: (i) transaction costs are expensed; (ii)
	contingent consideration is recognized at fair value at the acquisition date; and (iii) the fair value of contingent consideration is re-measured each period.&#160;&#160;This standard is not applicable to acquisitions where control is not obtained.
</FONT>
<BR>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	15
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="4">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage58"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Year ended December 31, 2009 acquisitions:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company completed three individually insignificant acquisitions in the Residential Property Management and Property Services operating segments during the year ended December 31, 2009.&#160;&#160;Details of these acquisitions are as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>

<TR BGCOLOR="#CCEEFF">

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">

	Current assets
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">

<TD VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="7%" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	253
</FONT>
</TD>
<TD NOWRAP VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR BGCOLOR="WHITE">
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="90%">
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Long-term assets
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD ALIGN="RIGHT" VALIGN="BOTTOM" WIDTH="1%">

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The fair value of the non-controlling interest was determined using an income approach with reference to a discounted fair cash flow model using the same assumptions implied in determining the purchase consideration.&#160;&#160;Acquisition-related costs of $54 were recorded in selling, general and administrative expenses.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Nine months ended December 31, 2008 acquisitions:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company completed six individually insignificant acquisitions across the three operating segments during the nine-month period ended December 31, 2008.&#160;&#160;The Company acquired non-controlling interests from shareholders in all operating segments.
</FONT>
<BR>

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Year ended March 31, 2008 acquisitions:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On October 1, 2007, the Company acquired 80% of the shares of Field Asset Services, Inc., a provider of property services to foreclosed residential properties on behalf of its financial institution clients, headquartered in Austin, Texas.&#160;&#160;The Company also completed 14 individually insignificant acquisitions in its Commercial
	Real Estate Services, Residential Property Management and Property Services segments during the year ended March 31, 2008.&#160;&#160;The Company acquired non-controlling interests from shareholders in all operating segments.
</FONT>
<BR>
</DIV>

<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#160;

<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	17
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="4">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage60"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The purchase prices of acquisitions resulted in the recognition of goodwill.&#160;&#160;The primary factors contributing to goodwill are assembled workforces, synergies with existing operations and future growth prospects.&#160;&#160;For acquisitions completed during the year ended December 31, 2009, goodwill in the amount of $1,929 is
	deductible for income tax purposes (nine-month period ended December 31, 2008 - $9,575; year ended March 31, 2008 - $49,410).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Certain vendors, at the time of acquisition, are entitled to receive contingent consideration if the acquired businesses achieve specified earnings levels during the one- to four-year periods following the dates of acquisition.&#160;&#160;For acquisitions made after December 31, 2008, contingent consideration was recorded at fair value
	on the date of acquisition and totaled $949.&#160;&#160;Such contingent consideration is paid in cash at the expiration of the contingency period.&#160;&#160;The fair value as at December 31, 2009 was $962.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The contingent consideration on pre-January 1, 2009 acquisitions is recorded when the contingencies are resolved and the consideration is paid or becomes payable, at which time the Company records the fair value of the consideration paid or payable, including interest, if any, as additional costs of the acquired businesses.&#160;&#160;Total
	contingent consideration recognized for the year ended December 31, 2009 was $10,513, net of income tax of $60 (nine-month period ended December 31, 2008 - $10,242, net of income tax of nil; year ended March 31, 2008 - $2,864, net of income tax of $1).&#160;&#160;Contingent consideration paid during the year ended December 31, 2009 was $12,364
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	&#160;
</FONT>
	(nine-month period ended December 31, 2008 - $4,734; year ended March 31, 2008 - $6,848) and the amount
	payable as at December 31, 2009 was $2,432 (December 31, 2008 - $5,508).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	As at December 31, 2009, there was contingent consideration outstanding of up to a maximum of $23,400 (December 31, 2008 - $51,800) in respect of both pre- and post-January 1, 2009 acquisitions.&#160;&#160;The contingencies will expire during the period extending to February 2012.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The acquisitions referred to above were accounted for by the purchase method of accounting for business combinations. Accordingly, the accompanying consolidated statements of earnings do not include any revenues or expenses related to these acquisitions prior to their respective closing dates.&#160;&#160;The consideration for the acquisitions
	during the year ended December 31, 2009 was financed from cash on hand.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Following are the Company&#8217;s unaudited consolidated pro forma results assuming the acquisitions occurred on the first day of the period of acquisition.&#160;&#160;The period immediately prior to the period of acquisition also includes the pro forma results of the acquisitions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

	These unaudited consolidated pro forma results have been prepared for illustrative purposes only and do not purport to be indicative of results of operations that would have actually resulted had the combinations been in effect at the beginning of each period or of future results of operations.

<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	18
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="4">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage61"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	4.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Dispositions
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In July 2008, the Company completed the sale of the businesses comprising its Integrated Security Services (&#8220;ISS&#8221;) segment.&#160;&#160;As a condition to closing, the Company was required to acquire the non-controlling interests of its non-wholly owned ISS subsidiaries.&#160;&#160;The Company received aggregate cash consideration
	of $162,385 ($155,031 net of cash sold).&#160;&#160;The pre-tax gain on the disposal was $80,497, before current income taxes of $10,788, resulting in a net gain of $69,709.&#160;&#160;The net gain on disposal included the realization of a gain of $6,792 related to cumulative foreign currency translation.&#160;&#160;The ISS segment has been reported as discontinued operations for all periods presented.&#160;&#160;&#160;Included in discontinued operations for the year ended December 31, 2009 was an after-tax gain
	of $791 on the final settlement of ISS working capital.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In December 2008, the Company decided to sell its Chicago-based US mortgage brokerage and servicing operation (&#8220;USMB&#8221;) due to adverse credit market conditions.&#160;&#160;USMB was previously reported within the Commercial Real Estate Services segment.&#160;&#160;The Company wrote the net assets of USMB down to fair value less
	cost to sell as of December 31, 2008, with a loss in the amount of $11,021, which included a deferred income tax valuation allowance of $1,501.&#160;&#160;In May 2009, the Company completed the sale of USMB and received aggregate consideration of $2,000.&#160;&#160;The after-tax loss on the disposal for 2009 was $367 (net of income taxes of nil).&#160;&#160;USMB has been reported as discontinued operations for all periods presented.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In January 2008, the Company decided to exit its Canadian commercial mortgage securitization operation (&#8220;CCMS&#8221;) due to adverse credit market conditions.&#160;&#160;CCMS was previously reported within the Commercial Real Estate Services segment.&#160;&#160;The exit was complete as of March 31, 2008 except for the disposal of
	the remaining mortgage loans receivable.&#160;&#160;The last remaining mortgage assets were disposed of in 2009.&#160;&#160;This operation has been reported as discontinued operations for all periods presented.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In March 2006, the Company sold its 88.3% interest in Resolve Corporation (&#8220;Resolve&#8221;), its Business Services segment, to a subsidiary of Resolve Business Outsourcing Income Fund (&#8220;RBO Fund&#8221;) upon the initial public offering of RBO Fund.&#160;&#160;Resolve is reported as discontinued operations for all periods presented.&#160;&#160;During
	the year ended March 31, 2008, a gain was recognized in connection with the settlement of a liability related to the Resolve disposal.&#160;&#160;The settlement resulted in a cash payment to the purchaser of the disposed operation in the amount of $1,036 and a gain on settlement in the amount of $2,265 (including an income tax benefit of $187).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>

	19

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company&#8217;s available-for-sale equity securities at December 31, 2008 consisted of securities of a subsidiary of RBO Fund (see note 4) which were sold during the year.&#160;&#160;During the nine-month period ended December 31, 2008, the Company&#8217;s available-for-sale securities were determined to be other-than-temporarily impaired
	and a non-cash charge of $14,680 ($12,038 net of income taxes) was recorded in the statement of earnings as of December 31, 2008.
</FONT>

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In October 2009, the Company acquired 29.99% of the shares of Colliers CRE plc, a publicly traded commercial real estate business in the United Kingdom.&#160;&#160;The shares are included in equity method investments.&#160;&#160;The cost of the shares was $13,955 and as at December 31, 2009, the market value of the investment was $14,200.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>

<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">

<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	23
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="4">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage66"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	During the year ended December 31, 2009, charges of $1,491 (nine-month period ended December 31, 2008 - $275; year ended March 31, 2008 - $1,149) were recognized in connection with impairments of intangible assets.&#160;&#160;In all three periods, the impairments were attributable to faster than expected erosion of customer relationships
	in the Commercial Real Estate and Residential Property Management segments.&#160;&#160;The charges were recorded in amortization expense.&#160;&#160;The fair values of the intangible assets and the asset groups they are components of were estimated using discounted expected future cash flows. The fair value measurement is classified in Level 3 of the fair value hierarchy as a result of the use of unobservable inputs including expected future cash flows and a discount rate.
</FONT>
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	A test for goodwill impairment is required to be completed annually, in the Company&#8217;s case as of August 1, or more frequently if events or changes in circumstances indicate the asset might be impaired.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	During the year, the Company was required to perform goodwill impairment tests due to a continuing deterioration of economic conditions negatively impacting the performance of the Commercial Real Estate segment. The Company determined that there were impairments in the North America and Central Europe &amp; Latin America reporting units
	within the segment driven by adverse economic conditions and sharply reduced brokerage activity. The fair values of the reporting units were determined using discounted cash flow models, which fall within Level 3 of the fair value hierarchy and is based on management&#8217;s forecast and current economic trends.&#160;&#160;The amount of the impairment loss related to the two reporting units was $29,583 (net of income tax of nil).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	24
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="4">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage67"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Based on the August 1, 2009 annual test, no other goodwill impairments were identified.&#160;&#160;If, in future periods, weak economic conditions persist and operating results deteriorate, a further goodwill impairment charge may be necessary.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">

	Goodwill in the amount of $10,682 related to the USMB discontinued operation was written off as of December 31, 2008.

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	On September 6, 2007, the Company entered into an amended and restated credit agreement with a syndicate of banks to provide a $225,000 committed revolving credit facility with a five-year term.&#160;&#160;The amended revolving credit facility bears interest at 0.75% to 1.30% over floating reference rates, depending on certain leverage
	ratios determined quarterly.&#160;&#160;The weighted average interest rate for 2009 was 1.3%
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE;" FACE="SYMBOL, SERIF">
	.&#160;&#160;
</FONT>
	The revolving credit facility had $142,728 of available un-drawn credit as at December 31, 2009 ($134,236 was un-drawn at December 31, 2008).&#160;&#160;As of December 31, 2009, letters of credit in the amount of $12,772 were outstanding ($5,782 as at December 31, 2008).&#160;&#160;The revolving credit facility requires a commitment fee of 0.25%
	to 0.50% of the unused portion, depending on certain leverage ratios, and also includes an uncommitted accordion provision providing an additional $50,000 of borrowing capacity under certain circumstances.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company has outstanding $28,570 of 8.06% fixed-rate Senior Notes (the &#8220;8.06% Notes&#8221;) (December 31, 2008 - $42,856).&#160;&#160;The 8.06% Notes have a final maturity of June 29, 2011, with seven equal annual principal repayments, which began on June 29, 2005.&#160;&#160;The Company also has outstanding $50,000 of 6.40% fixed-rate
	Senior Notes (the &#8220;6.40% Notes&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The 6.40% Notes have a final maturity of September 30, 2015 with four equal annual principal repayments commencing on September 30, 2012.&#160;&#160;The Company also has outstanding $100,000 of 5.44% fixed-rate Senior Notes (the &#8220;5.44% Notes&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The 5.44% Notes have a final maturity of April 1, 2015 with five equal annual principal repayments beginning on April 1, 2011.
</FONT>
<BR>
</DIV>
<BR>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS">
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	25
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="4">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage68"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 8PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company has indemnified the holders of the 8.06% Notes, 6.40% Notes and 5.44% Notes (collectively, the &#8220;Notes&#8221;) from all withholding tax that is or may become applicable to any payments made by the Company on the Notes.&#160;&#160;The Company believes this exposure is not material as of December 31, 2009.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The revolving credit facility and the Notes rank equally in terms of seniority.&#160;&#160;The Company has granted these lenders collateral including the following: an interest in all of the assets of the Company including the Company&#8217;s shares of its subsidiaries; an assignment of material contracts; and an assignment of the Company&#8217;s
	&#8220;call&#8221; rights with respect to shares of the subsidiaries held by non-controlling interests.&#160;&#160;The Convertible Debentures are subordinate to the revolving credit facility and the Notes and are unsecured.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The covenants of the revolving credit facility and the Notes agreements require the Company to maintain certain ratios including leverage, fixed charge coverage, interest coverage and net worth.&#160;&#160;The Company is prohibited from undertaking certain mergers, acquisitions and dispositions without prior approval.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In November 2009, the Company issued $77,000 principal amount of 6.50% Convertible Unsecured Subordinate Debentures (&#8220;Convertible Debentures&#8221;) in a public offering.&#160;&#160;The Convertible Debentures have a final maturity of December 31, 2014 and were issued at par.&#160;&#160;At the holder&#8217;s option, the Convertible
	Debentures may be converted at any time prior to maturity into Subordinate Voting Shares based on an initial conversion rate of approximately 35.7143 common shares per $1,000 principal amount of Convertible Debentures (which represents an initial conversion price of $28.00 per share).&#160;&#160;The Company may also, at its option, redeem the Convertible Debentures at any time on or after December 31, 2012.&#160;&#160;For redemptions between December 31, 2012 and December 30, 2013, the Convertible Debentures
	may be redeemed in whole or in part provided that the 20-day volume weighted average trading price of the Subordinate Voting Shares is not less than 125% of the conversion price.&#160;&#160;For redemptions after December 31, 2013 and prior to maturity, redemption, in whole or in part, will be at par plus accrued and unpaid interest.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	Subject to specified conditions, the Company has the right to repay the outstanding principal amount of the Convertible Debentures, on maturity or redemption, through the issuance of Subordinate Voting Shares.&#160;&#160;The Company also has the option to satisfy its obligation to pay interest through the issuance and sale of Subordinate
	Voting Shares.&#160;&#160;The Convertible Debentures are unsecured and contain no financial ratio covenants.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	In connection with the issuance of the Convertible Debentures, the Company incurred financing costs of $3,603 which will be amortized over five years using the effective interest rate method.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The effective interest rate on the Company&#8217;s long-term debt and Convertible Debentures for the year ended December 31, 2009 was 4.7% (year ended December 31, 2008 - 5.4%).&#160;&#160;The estimated aggregate amount of principal repayments on long-term debt required in each of the next five years ending December 31 and thereafter to
	meet the retirement provisions are as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>

<BR>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="WIDTH: 100%; TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER">

<A NAME="eolPage69"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	12.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Non-controlling interests
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The minority equity positions in the Company&#8217;s subsidiaries are referred to as non-controlling interests (&#8220;NCI&#8221;).&#160;&#160;The NCI are considered to be redeemable securities.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, the NCI is recorded at the greater of (i) the redemption amount or (ii) the amount initially recorded as NCI at the date
	of inception of the minority equity position.&#160;&#160;This amount is recorded in the &#8220;mezzanine&#8221; section of the balance sheet, outside of shareholders&#8217; equity.&#160;&#160;Changes in the NCI amount are recognized immediately as they occur.&#160;&#160;The following table provides a reconciliation of the beginning and ending NCI amounts:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<A NAME="FIS_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE_35"></A>

<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The Company has shareholders&#8217; agreements in place at each of its non-wholly owned subsidiaries.&#160;&#160;These agreements allow the Company to &#8220;call&#8221; the non-controlling interest at a price determined with the use of a formula price, which is usually equal to a fixed multiple of average annual net earnings before extraordinary
	items, income taxes, interest, depreciation, and amortization.&#160;&#160;The agreements also have redemption features which allow the owners of the NCI to &#8220;put&#8221; their equity to the Company at the same price subject to certain limitations.&#160;&#160;The formula price is referred to as the redemption amount and may be paid in cash or in Subordinate Voting Shares.&#160;&#160;The redemption amount as of December 31, 2009 was $156,787.&#160;&#160;If all put or call options were settled with Subordinated
	Voting Shares as at December 31, 2009, approximately 8,300,000 such shares would be issued.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	13.&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;Capital stock
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	The authorized capital stock of the Company is as follows:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT">
<BR>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 36PT; TEXT-INDENT: 36PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	An unlimited number of Preferred Shares, issuable in series;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 72PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	An unlimited number of Subordinate Voting Shares having one vote per share; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 72PT; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN">
	An unlimited number of Multiple Voting Shares having 20 votes per share, convertible at any time into Subordinate Voting Shares at a rate of one Subordinate Voting Share for each Multiple Voting Share outstanding.
</FONT>
<BR>
</DIV>
